comments:
With eclipse-platorm-3.3m6-win32 on Windows XP SP1, Sun 1.4.2_13:

Help > Software Updates > Find and Install > Search for New Features
  Add 2 remote sites:
    1: Eclipse 3.3 Milestone Updates, 
    2: TM testUpdates
  Select both sites, press next, select the original Eclipse site.

Expand the TM testUpdates site, select a feature. UM detects that the feature depends on something which is available on the other (3.3 Milestone Updates Site). Observe following NPE, which is not critical since it is just logged but everything else works as expected:

java.lang.NullPointerException
	at org.eclipse.update.internal.ui.wizards.ReviewPage$TreeContentProvider.getParent(ReviewPage.java:185)
	at org.eclipse.update.internal.ui.wizards.ReviewPage.getSite(ReviewPage.java:1398)
	at org.eclipse.update.internal.ui.wizards.ReviewPage.access$29(ReviewPage.java:1395)
	at org.eclipse.update.internal.ui.wizards.ReviewPage$14.run(ReviewPage.java:837)
	at org.eclipse.jface.operation.ModalContext$ModalContextThread.run(ModalContext.java:113)

I am seeing this error even when updating from single update site. The NPE pops up when I check individual features (even those that are perfectly valid on their own), and when I close NPE error dialog Next button is not enabled. The only workaround is to check parent node and then uncheck features you don't want to install, which is quite time consuming and users will hit into it every time when updating from Callisto/Europa update site.

So, I believe severity of this issue should be increased.

Using the scenario in bug #188318, I could not reproduce the issue any more -- no NPEs seen anywhere. But I did not test the original error report.

Eugene could you give it a try with 3.3RC1 so it can be marked WORKSFORM, hopefully?

I've just had this NPE in I20070625-1500 (3.3) after checking all update site and then trying to check
Europa Discovery Site >  Web and JEE Dev. > Eclipse XML Editors and Tools.

(See problem analysis below.)

!ENTRY org.eclipse.update.ui 4 0 2007-07-24 16:32:13.953
!MESSAGE java.lang.NullPointerException
!STACK 0
java.lang.NullPointerException
        at org.eclipse.update.internal.ui.wizards.ReviewPage$TreeContentProvider.getParent(ReviewPage.java:181)
        at org.eclipse.update.internal.ui.wizards.ReviewPage.getSite(ReviewPage.java:1402)
        at org.eclipse.update.internal.ui.wizards.ReviewPage.access$29(ReviewPage.java:1399)
        at org.eclipse.update.internal.ui.wizards.ReviewPage$14.run(ReviewPage.java:840)
        at org.eclipse.jface.operation.ModalContext$ModalContextThread.run(ModalContext.java:113)


The install I used had a probably outdated version of GEF installed, which resulted in a bunch of messages like the one below in the log.

The problem is that SiteBookmark.getSite(boolean, IProgressMonitor) catches and logs the CoreException, and then returns null, which must result in an NPE in ReviewPage.TreeContentProvider.getParent(Object):
  if (sites[i].getSite(false, null).getURL() != 
      f.getSite().getSiteContentProvider().getURL()) {


!MESSAGE Unable to access site: "http://download.eclipse.org/tools/gef/milestones/update-site/site.xml" [Server returned HTTP response code: "404 Not
Found" for URL: http://download.eclipse.org/tools/gef/milestones/update-site/site.xml.]
!STACK 0
org.eclipse.update.internal.core.FatalIOException: Server returned HTTP response code: "404 Not Found" for URL: http://download.eclipse.org/tools/gef/
milestones/update-site/site.xml.
        at org.eclipse.update.internal.core.UpdateManagerUtils.checkConnectionResult(UpdateManagerUtils.java:562)
        at org.eclipse.update.internal.core.SiteURLFactory.createSite(SiteURLFactory.java:74)
        at org.eclipse.update.internal.core.InternalSiteManager.createSite(InternalSiteManager.java:334)
        at org.eclipse.update.internal.core.InternalSiteManager.createSite(InternalSiteManager.java:326)
        at org.eclipse.update.internal.core.InternalSiteManager.createSite(InternalSiteManager.java:291)
        at org.eclipse.update.internal.core.InternalSiteManager.attemptCreateSite(InternalSiteManager.java:222)
        at org.eclipse.update.internal.core.InternalSiteManager.getSite(InternalSiteManager.java:162)
        at org.eclipse.update.core.SiteManager.getSite(SiteManager.java:115)
        at org.eclipse.update.internal.ui.model.SiteBookmark.connect(SiteBookmark.java:138)
        at org.eclipse.update.internal.ui.model.SiteBookmark.connect(SiteBookmark.java:130)
        at org.eclipse.update.internal.ui.model.SiteBookmark.getSite(SiteBookmark.java:116)
        at org.eclipse.update.internal.ui.wizards.ReviewPage$TreeContentProvider.getParent(ReviewPage.java:181)
        at org.eclipse.update.internal.ui.wizards.ReviewPage.getSite(ReviewPage.java:1402)
        at org.eclipse.update.internal.ui.wizards.ReviewPage.access$29(ReviewPage.java:1399)
        at org.eclipse.update.internal.ui.wizards.ReviewPage$14.run(ReviewPage.java:840)
        at org.eclipse.jface.operation.ModalContext$ModalContextThread.run(ModalContext.java:113)
*** Bug 191060 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
